gameDetails.matchup: New Orleans Pelicans vs Orlando Magic

keyFactors.title: Elite 3PT Shooter on High Volume
keyFactors.description: Murphy shooting 43.7% from three on 8.9 attempts per game (leads Pelicans). Top-5 in NBA in three-point attempts. Pure floor-spacing specialist.

keyFactors.title: Pelicans Injury Situation = Expanded Role
keyFactors.description: Brandon Ingram OUT (hamstring), Zion Williamson OUT (hamstring), Jose Alvarado OUT (oblique). Murphy is primary perimeter scoring option by default. Usage rate up to 27.1% (from 22.3% career).

keyFactors.title: Orlando's Corner Three Defense
keyFactors.description: Magic ranked 26th in opponent corner 3PT% (41.2%). Murphy takes 47% of his threes from corners. Exploitable matchup weakness.

keyFactors.title: Blowout Potential = Garbage Time
keyFactors.description: Pelicans favored by 7.5 points at home. If game gets out of hand, Murphy stays in to maintain spacing and gets clean looks in low-pressure situations.

keyFactors.title: Historical Dominance of This Line
keyFactors.description: Murphy has hit 3+ threes in 8 of last 9 games (88.9%). 2.5 is extremely low bar for a player averaging 3.9 3PM. Would need catastrophic game to miss.

riskFactors: Heavy juice at -165 requires 62.3% hit rate to break even
Could sit in 4th quarter if blowout (but likely hits by then)
Orlando's length on perimeter (Carter Jr., Banchero) could contest shots

quarterBreakdown.description: Murphy hit 2 corner threes in first 6 minutes. Pelicans jumped to 32-18 lead.
Hit ONE OVER line with transition three at 8:22 mark (3 total threes). Added another before halftime. Pelicans led 64-41 at half.
Game became blowout. Murphy hit wing three at 5:13 mark (5th three). Sat rest of quarter with 27-point lead.
Did not play in 4th quarter (blowout management). Bet long secured.

gameResults.whenHit: Hit OVER (3 threes) with 8:22 remaining in 2nd quarter. Bet never in doubt. Added 2 more for massive cushion.
gameResults.gamePace: 203 total points (under projection). Blowout slowed pace in 2nd half, but damage was done by halftime.
gameResults.defenseAdjustment: Magic had no answer for Murphy's movement shooting. Consistently late on closeouts from corners.

whatWentRight.title: Blowout Script (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentRight.description: Pelicans dominated from opening tip. 27-point win meant Murphy played aggressively early, hit OVER by halftime, then preserved health. Exactly as projected.

whatWentRight.title: Corner Three Exploitation
whatWentRight.description: 3 of Murphy's 5 threes came from corners (60% of makes). Orlando's defensive weakness was fully exploited. Pre-game edge calculation was spot-on.

whatWentRight.title: High Volume Despite Blowout
whatWentRight.description: 10 three-point attempts in 31 minutes. Even with limited 4th quarter time, Murphy got his shots. Volume edge materialized.

whatWentRight.title: Injury Situation Boost
whatWentRight.description: With Ingram and Zion out, Murphy took 15 FGA (team-high). Usage rate was exactly as predicted. No competition for shots.

whatWentRight.title: Clean Shooting Form
whatWentRight.description: 50% from three on high volume. Not just hitting OVER, but crushing it (5 threes = 2x the line). When edge is this large, expect positive variance.

statisticalContext.vsPropLine: +2.5 threes (OVER by 2.5, exactly double the line)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Expected positive outcome. With 88.9% hit rate over last 9 games and massive usage advantage, this was not variance - this was edge exploitation. 5 threes on 10 attempts is well within expected range for elite shooter. Everything went according to plan.

closingLineValue.verdict: Strong CLV (+30 cents equivalent). Line moved from -165 to -195 before tipoff. Early action on injury news captured value. Market caught up but we got better price.

keyTakeaways: Injury situations creating usage gaps are EXTREMELY exploitable for role players
Low lines (2.5) for high-volume shooters (8.9 3PA) = massive edge even with juice
88.9% hit rate over 9-game sample is statistically significant (not small sample noise)
Blowout games favor OVERS for specialists who play early then sit (bet secured by halftime)
Opponent-specific weaknesses (corner 3PT defense) = additional edge layer
Heavy juice (-165) is acceptable when edge is this pronounced (22% edge vs 12.3% juice)
Would lay -165 on this exact scenario 100 times without hesitation
verdict: Textbook value bet with multiple edge layers. Process and results in perfect alignment. This is what 'max edge' looks like.
